reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner & I stayed in Stewart's Bay for two nights in June. The location is great - walkable to the Port Arthur historic site, and the Tasman Island cruise HQ is just next to the main entrance. The grocery store is also just up the road. We requested a water view cabin and they were able to accomodate us, even though we only booked a week in advance. The quiet Stewart's Bay is beautiful, with walking tracks all along the property leading to the small secluded beach. DVDs are available from reception, as is internet access. The breakfast buffet included at the restaurant was great. I only had a few complaints, but I'm really being picky here:
reviews.title: Overall, very good choice for Port Arthur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: -I had to make a call for work upon arrival (beware- unless you have Telstra you will have NO mobile service outside of Hobart). As the cabins have no phones, I was told to drive up the road and use the public phone - in the rain.
reviews.title: Great location, great accomodation, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Fan above shower inadequate - as a result, there is a bit of black mould in the shower and above it
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting - Would only stay for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -internet access in reception was overpriced at $5 per 30 mins and very slow.
reviews.title: Excellent luxury cabin accommodation close to Port Arthur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Dinners at Taylor's restaurant good but inconsistent - I ordered seafood marinara the first night, and liked it so much I ordered it again the next night- however it was half the size of the previous night, and not as nice.
reviews.title: Beautiful location - will definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Very un-secluded cabin smelling of fake air freshener that did not dissipate after 2 hours of opened doors and windows. Crumbs on the couch and old stains. Dust covered cobwebs draped over the kitchen table. The door handle was about to fall off the front door. There was no coffee available, and the cups were dirty in the cupboard. No washing up liquid (only water in the bottle), and the fly spray can was empty to combat the flies that could enter through the flyscreens that weren't fitted properly.
reviews.title: Old opened milk, crumbs and lack of care from staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excuse of the cabin being in bad condition that a charity had used it the night before. If the rooms couldn't be cleaned on one busy night, how do they cope with the high peak summer season? I was then told to walk to the restaurant for coffee.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful modern rooms, highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: The cabin was not secluded with every window facing a road or pathway with people looking in as they passed, with no view at all of the beach and the screech of kids in the spa next door. Old coffee granules still in the plunger, two milks in the fridge had been opened and then had the covers folded back over. The shower hose leaked, mould on window ledges, no floor towel for shower, kitchen floor was sticky under foot, no menu in cabin.
reviews.title: I recently stayed at Stewarts Bay Lodge...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is advertised as 4.5 star accommodation. The receptionist said the cabins are only 3 star but no where on the wotfi site does it say this. I feel duped. I could have paid less for the same quality than being misled by the rating and details. Simple hygiene was a problem and staff seemed uncaring. I would never have paid $450 as it stated the rate normally was. Other people didn't look happy either at checkout.
reviews.title: Excellent Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: At least the bed was comfortable. Avoid and stay elsewhere or get a tent and camp instead :-)
reviews.title: Excellent base for all Tasman peninsula activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Stewart Bay Lodge in a Deluxe Spa Cabin for 2 nights. The price of the package for 2 nights and the quality of the rooms makes it a very good deal !
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabins are very spacious for 2 people, the spa is awesome and the view from all rooms is stunning!
reviews.title: Excellant location for Port Arthur Prison visits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw some wallabies, had a walk from the hotel to Port Arthur Historic Site, played tennis,... It was really relaxing.
reviews.title: Superb Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast at the restaurant is gorgeous. The TV displayed the latest movies.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location for a Dream Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really, Stewart Bay Lodge seems to be THE place to stay in Port Arthur.
reviews.title: Peaceful, romantic and perfect location for visiting the Port Arthur area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the spa cabin which was excellent. Regret that it was only one night but a great base to visit Port Arthur and superb restaurant.
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were really surprised by this lodge. We had a fantastic luxury modern cabin with views over the bay. It was such a beautiful place we regretted only staying two nights. Highly recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Beautiful Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our wood cabin had two bedrooms. Great cooking facilities. Modern touches, but not new. Close to amazing beach beach. Outdoor spa, tennis court. Kids play area. Walking distance to Port Arthur. Local shop nearby. Would rate 3.5 star. Some interesting natural features nearby - blow holes, water caves. No optus phone or data reception. Has a fancy Restaurant on-site which was OK - we preferred to cook our own. Also free electric BBQ on-site.
reviews.title: Cabin style and well positioned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the newer 2 bedroom lodges with lovely views over the beach, there was everything you could need for a holiday from washing machine to dishwasher, very well equipped. The lounge area and the balcony had lovely views and we enjoyed our breakfast listening to the birds and admiring the view.
reviews.title: Definitely worth a stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little disppointed by the restaurant, Taylors, thought it was very expensive for the quality of food although again it is in lovely spot, would probably chose to self cater next time or try somewhere else.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay
